alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 5:59PM MST until August 23 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL GRAHAM COUNTY... At 559 PM MST, Radar indicated that the heaviest rainfall had moved south of the area but earlier downpours will likely continue to cause runoff problems in town, along with elevated flows in small streams and normally dry washes. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Safford, Thatcher, Solomon and Safford Regional Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
